content:
# We have successfully gathered another 10 units of copper ore, bringing our total to 10 copper ore in addition to our current inventory of 5 iron ore, 5 coal, and 5 stone. 
# The first furnace is still operational and has produced 15 iron plates, while the second furnace has produced 11 copper plates but is still processing the remaining copper ore.

# To ensure that we can continue crafting, we should insert the newly gathered copper ore into the copper furnace to produce more copper plates.
# Let's insert the copper ore and some coal into the copper furnace.

insert_item(Prototype.CopperOre, furnace_copper, quantity=10)  # Insert 10 units of copper ore into the copper furnace
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace_copper, quantity=5)  # Insert 5 units of coal into the copper furnace

# After inserting the materials, let’s check the inventory before monitoring the furnace for production.
print(f"Final Inventory: {inspect_inventory()} after adding copper ore to the furnace.")  # Check inventory after inserting

# Now, we will monitor the copper furnace for a maximum of 30 seconds to see if any new copper plates are produced.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum wait time for smelting
    if inspect_inventory(furnace_copper)[Prototype.CopperPlate] >= 2:  # Check if we have produced at least 2 new copper plates
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Copper smelting timeout - check inputs.")

# Finally, we should check the inventory and the status of the entities again after the smelting attempt of copper plates.
print(f"Final Inventory: {inspect_inventory()} after attempting to smelt copper plates.")  # Final inventory check
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()} after production status.")  # Check entity status again.
